title: 5 Mistakes Killing Your Reels Reach (And How to Fix Them)
excerpt: Why is nobody watching your videos? You might be making one of these beginner mistakes. Read how to give Instagram algorithms exactly what they want.
content:
1. The First 3 Seconds Decide

People don't have time. If you don't grab them immediately, they scroll past. Forget long logos and intros. Get straight to the point.

2. Bad Lighting

You don't need a hundred-thousand-dollar camera, but you need light. Daylight from a window is free and looks great.

3. Missing Captions

Up to 40% of people watch videos without sound. If you don't have captions, you lose half your audience.

4. No Call to Action (CTA)

What should people do after watching? Tell them. 'Follow for more tips', 'Click the link in bio'.

5. Boring

Entertain, educate, inspire. If the video brings no value, the algorithm will bury it.

title: How Much Does Video Advertising Really Cost in 2025?
excerpt: Breakdown of video production pricing. What do you pay a freelance cameraman for, and what do you pay a big agency for? And where can you save?
content:
Not All Video Is Created Equal

The price of a video can range from £200 to £20,000. Why such a difference?

1. Freelancer vs. Agency

With a freelancer, you pay for one person's time. With an agency, you pay for an account manager, creative, producer, director... and office rent.

2. High-End Tech?

Are we shooting on an iPhone or a RED camera? Do we need a drone? Light setup?

3. Post-production

Editing, coloring, sound, music, graphics. This often takes 3x more time than the shooting itself.

Where to Save?

The best price/performance ratio today is offered by Hybrid Production - one experienced creator with quality equipment (like me) who handles everything from camera to editing. You don't pay unnecessary management, only the result.

title: Why Your Facebook Ads Aren't Working (Viewer Psychology)
excerpt: Spending needed on PPC but no sales? The problem isn't the ad settings, but the creative. Find out how to engage.
content:
People Hate Ads

Nobody goes on Facebook to watch ads. People want to be entertained or see what friends are doing.

The 'Native Content' Rule

Your ad must not look like an ad. It must look like TikTok, like a Vlog, like entertainment. This is called UGC (User Generated Content) style.

Emotions Sell

A boring list of product parameters interests no one. Show how the person will FEEL when they use the product. Show the problem and its solution.
